definition: ice/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/to chill sth/(of an object or substance) to feel cold/(of a person) cold/unfriendly/(slang) methamphetamine
knife/blade/single-edged sword/cutlass/CL:把[ba3]/(slang) dollar (loanword)/classifier for sets of one hundred sheets (of paper)/classifier for knife cuts or stabs

sentences.english: An early morning in early April, sunbeams drop on the ground like ice blades.
sentences.chinese: 四月初，早上的陽光好像冰刀，一條一條掉到地上。

sentences.english: These methods are applied successfully in NC grinding machine used in skates machining.
sentences.chinese: 該方法在數控冰刀研磨機上得到成功的應用。

sentences.english: Compared with the prior speed skate blade, the utility model has the advantages of higher sliding efficiency and higher difficulty of fatigue.
sentences.chinese: 比起現有的速滑冰刀，它滑行效率更高，更不易疲勞。

sentences.english: The modern ice-sports bring more demands to the quality of skates.
sentences.chinese: 冰上運動的發展對冰刀的質量提出了更高的要求。

sentences.english: Ice melts under the blades of the skates and this makes them slide easily.
sentences.chinese: 冰刀下面的冰熔化了，這使他們滑起冰來更輕鬆。

definition: to freeze over/to ice over/icebound/to shelve (a proposal etc)
cutting edge or point of a knife, sword or tool
